perturbation.explanation: Moving the anti-corruption clause to the section discussing headings creates a structural flaw. The anti-corruption clause contains crucial legal obligations, and placing it under 'Headings' misleads parties about its relevance and reduces its enforceability. This violates the spirit of FCPA compliance, which requires clear and prominent placement of such clauses.

13.3 Arbitration.

(a) Any and all disputes that are not resolved pursuant to Section 13.2 shall be finally settled by binding arbitration administered under the Rules of Arbitration of the International Chamber of Commerce by three (3) arbitrators appointed in accordance with said Rules. The arbitration will be conducted in New York, New York. The language to be used in the arbitral proceedings will be English. Judgment on the award may be entered in any court having jurisdiction.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.5 Non-Compete Covenant. During the Term, without the prior written approval of Zogenix, Distributor shall not, and shall cause its Affiliates not to, either directly or indirectly, file for Regulatory Approval of, promote, market, offer for sale, sell, import or distribute in the Territory any product containing fenfluramine or any salt, enantiomer, or polymorph of fenfluramine, or any product for [***].

13.3 (a) Any and all disputes that are not resolved pursuant to Section 13.2 shall be finally settled by binding arbitration administered under mutual agreement by both parties.
perturbation.explanation: Relocating the arbitration clause to the Non-compete Covenant makes it easy to overlook. Furthermore, the 'mutual agreement' clause replaces any explicit legal method. This introduces uncertainty since some jurisdictions may require binding arbitration agreements to follow international chamber of commerce rules. By not following these rules, the enforceability is questionable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: International Chamber of Commerce Arbitration Rules

The Parties acknowledge and agree that it is their mutual objective and intent to minimize, to the extent feasible under the Applicable Laws, any taxes payable in connection with this Agreement, and shall reasonably cooperate each other in good faith in accordance with Applicable Laws to minimize any Taxes in connection with this Agreement, including provision of any tax forms and other information that may be reasonably necessary in order for the paying Party not to withhold tax or to withhold tax at a reduced rate under an applicable bilateral income tax treaty.

perturbation.explanation: Relocating tax liabilities to trademark rights introduces confusion, where financial obligations should be clearly stated in payment terms. The phrase 'shall be something the Distributor shall bear, and is not responsible for,' introduces contradictionâ€”it suggests the distributor is responsible (bears the cost) but then absolves them of responsibility, undermining clarity.
